thesauri.description: The IUCN Red List Categories and Criteria were developed for assessing extinction risk at the global level, considering the global population of a taxon.      The threat statuses in this vocabulary also include two additional regional statuses from IUCN used for non-endemic species at regional or national levels (RE & NA).
thesauri.title: IUCN Threat Status Vocabulary

thesauri.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes are two-letter country codes defined in ISO 3166-1, part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), to represent countries, dependent territories, and special areas of geographical interest. They are the most widely used of the country codes published by ISO (the others being alpha-3 and numeric), and are used most prominently for the Internet's country code top-level domains (with a few exceptions). They were first included as part of the ISO 3166 standard in its first edition in 1974.  XK for Kosovo has been added here.
thesauri.title: ISO 3166-1 Alpha2 Country Codes

thesauri.description: This controlled vocabulary is the same as used in the TDWG Taxon Concept Transfer Schema. These are the allowable terms in the 'type' attribute of TaxonRelationshipAssertion in RCS.
thesauri.title: Taxon Concept Relationship Types

thesauri.description: The status vocabulary is a classification for native/alien/cryptogenic status of species in a given area, developed under the leadership of the IUCN Species Survival Commission Invasive Species Specialist Group (IUCN SSC ISSG). The vocabulary was published as supplementary material in Pagad et al., 2015, IUCN SSC Invasive Species Specialist Group: invasive alien species information management supporting practitioners, policy makers and decision takers (http://dx.doi.org/10.3391/mbi.2015.6.2.03).
thesauri.title: IUCN SSC ISSG Status Vocabulary

thesauri.description: The Pathway vocabulary is a classification for pathways of entry for invasive alien species, developed under the leadership of the IUCN Species Survival Commission Invasive Species Specialist Group (IUCN SSC ISSG). The vocabulary was published as supplementary material in Pagad et al., 2015, IUCN SSC Invasive Species Specialist Group: invasive alien species information management supporting practitioners, policy makers and decision takers (http://dx.doi.org/10.3391/mbi.2015.6.2.03).
thesauri.title: IUCN SSC ISSG Pathway Vocabulary

thesauri.description: The invasiveness vocabulary is a classification for invasiveness of introduced species, developed under the leadership of the IUCN Species Survival Commission Invasive Species Specialist Group (IUCN SSC ISSG). The vocabulary was published as supplementary material in Pagad et al., 2015, IUCN SSC Invasive Species Specialist Group: invasive alien species information management supporting practitioners, policy makers and decision takers (http://dx.doi.org/10.3391/mbi.2015.6.2.03).
thesauri.title: IUCN SSC ISSG Invasiveness Vocabulary

thesauri.description: A vocabulary representing vegetation layers, including aquatic vegetation layers, and their sub-layers.
thesauri.title: Vegetation Layer GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: A vocabulary representing compass directions including the four cardinal directions, the four intercardinal directions, plus eight further secondary-intercardinal directions.
thesauri.title: Direction GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Units of measurement, based on the International System of Units (SI) and other non-SI units accepted for use with the SI.
thesauri.title: Unit of Measurement Vocabulary

thesauri.description: The quantityType Vocabulary is a recommended set of values to use for the Darwin Core quantityType property.
thesauri.title: Quantity Type Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Vocabulary for dataset types used in the GBIF Network.
thesauri.title: GBIF Dataset Type Vocabulary

thesauri.description: An ordered taxonomic rank vocabulary with the most frequently used values and their alternative representations.
thesauri.title: Taxonomic Rank GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: The Permit Type Vocabulary is a recommended set of values to use for the permit type in the GGBN Permit Extension.
thesauri.title: GGBN Permit Type Vocabulary

thesauri.description: The Quality Vocabulary is a recommended set of values to use for the quality term in the GGBN Material Sample Extension.
thesauri.title: GGBN Quality Vocabulary

thesauri.description: The Preservation Temperature Vocabulary is a recommended set of values to use for the preservation temperature in the GGBN Preservation Extension.
thesauri.title: GGBN Preservation Temperature Vocabulary

thesauri.description: The Permit Status Vocabulary is a recommended set of values to use for the permit status in the GGBN Permit Extension.
thesauri.title: GGBN Permit Status Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Vocabulary that describes the frequency with which changes and additions are made to the dataset after the initial dataset is completed. The vocabulary is derived from the EML specification (version 2.1.1) at http://knb.ecoinformatics.org/software/eml/eml-2.1.1/eml-dataset.html#maintenanceUpdateFrequency/.
thesauri.title: EML Maintenance Update Frequency

thesauri.description: Describes the syntax of the habitat of a taxon and lists the habitat codes for Systema Naturae 2000. Source document last updated: 14 Aug 2003
thesauri.title: Systema Naturae 2000 Habitat Vocabulary

thesauri.description: The DCMI Type Vocabulary provides a general, cross-domain list of approved terms that may be used as values for the Resource Type element to identify the genre of a resource. The terms documented here are also included in the more comprehensive document "DCMI Metadata Terms" at http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/.
thesauri.title: Dublin Core Type Vocabulary

thesauri.description: The Type Vocabulary is a recommended set of values to use for the basisOfRecord term to categorize Darwin Core resources. The Darwin Core Type Vocabulary extends and refines terms from the Dublin Core Type Vocabulary to describe and categorize resources more specifically for biodiversity applications. The basisOfRecord should be populated with the value from the Darwin Core Type Vocabulary that best corresponds to the resource being shared.
thesauri.title: Darwin Core Type Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Vocabulary for the 3 CITES (Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora) Appendix numbers. Appendices I, II and III to the Convention are lists of species afforded different levels or types of protection from over-exploitation.
thesauri.title: CITES Appendix Numbers

thesauri.description: Codes for the representation of names of languages — Part 2: Alpha-3 code, is the second part of the ISO 639 standard, which lists codes for the representation of the names of languages. The three-letter codes given for each language in this part of the standard are referred to as "Alpha-3" codes. There are 464 entries in the list of ISO 639-2 codes.
thesauri.title: ISO 639-2 Language Codes

thesauri.description: Vocabulary for dataset types used in the GBIF Network.
thesauri.title: GBIF Dataset Type Vocabulary

thesauri.description: The method used to preserve specimens.  This vocabulary was based on the PreservationMethodClassVoc from the BioCASe MetaProfile
thesauri.title: Preservation Method GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Vocabulary to categorise paragraphs of a taxon description. The individual terms are selected according to common usage and in some cases are overlapping or broader/narrower terms of others.
thesauri.title: Description Type GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: A life form vocabulary targeted at plants and based on Raunkiær's definitions
thesauri.title: Life Form GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: A vocabulary to be used for a nomenclatural type status of a specimen or name. See also the related type reason vocabulary.
thesauri.title: Nomenclatural Type Status Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Vocabulary for agent roles used in EML.
thesauri.title: EML Agent Role Vocabulary

thesauri.description: A simple vocabulary to represent organism life stages across all kingdoms. Includes quite a few alternative terms
thesauri.title: Life Stage GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: A vocabulary classifying resources indexed by GBIF. This vocabulary is used exclusively by IPT versions 2.0.0 to 2.0.3.
thesauri.title: GBIF Resource Type Vocabulary

thesauri.description: A vocabulary to be used for reasons for a type designation of a specimen or name. See also the related type status vocabulary.
thesauri.title: Nomenclatural Type Designation Type Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Simple vocabulary to describe the taxonomic status of a name
thesauri.title: Taxonomic Status GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Vocabulary for Checklist or Occurrence dataset subtypes used in the GBIF Network.
thesauri.title: GBIF Dataset Subtype Vocabulary

thesauri.description: A short vocabulary representing an organisms sex
thesauri.title: Sex GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Common taxonomic ranks and their alternative representations
thesauri.title: Taxonomic Rank GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Vocabulary to categorise (literature) references
thesauri.title: Reference Type GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: The short vocabulary providing values for http://ns.adobe.com/xap/1.0/Rating with -1 defining rejected, 0 unrated, and 1 (worst) to 5 (best).
thesauri.title: The Audobon Rating Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Creative Commons licenses allowed in EOL
thesauri.title: Licenses EOL Vocabulary

thesauri.description: SPM categories for text descriptions that are allowed in EOL
thesauri.title: Subject EOL Vocabulary

thesauri.description: MIME type for EOL data objects
thesauri.title: MIME Type EOL Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Data types for EOL data objects
thesauri.title: Data types EOL Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Controlled values for the type of germplasm storage conditions.
thesauri.title: Type of germplasm storage conditions

thesauri.description: Controlled values for the type of germplasm acquisition source.
thesauri.title: Acquisition source type

thesauri.description: Controlled values for the types of germplasm material and their cultivation status.
thesauri.title: Biological status of germplasm

thesauri.description: Geological time, chronostratigraphic scale. Standard stratigraphic nomenclature based on palaeontological intervals of time defined by recognised fossil assemblages (GTS2004).
thesauri.title: GeoTime: ChronoStrat

thesauri.description: Geological time, magnetostratigraphic scale. Standard magnetostratigraphic nomenclature based on ... (GTS2004).
thesauri.title: GeoTime: MagnetoStrat

thesauri.description: Geological time, chronostratigraphic scale. Standard stratigraphic nomenclature based on palaeontological intervals of time defined by recognised fossil assemblages (GTS2004).
thesauri.title: GeoTime: ChronoStrat

thesauri.description: Geological time, magnetostratigraphic scale. Standard magnetostratigraphic nomenclature based on ... (GTS2004).
thesauri.title: GeoTime: MagnetoStrat

thesauri.description: This controlled vocabulary is based the TDWG LSID Ontology model for taxon occurrence interactions, developed by Kevin Richards in 2009 and aimed at describing the interactions between TaxonOccurrences, observations, specimens etc. Eg the Interaction class can be expressed a host/parasite relation between two TaxonOccurrences. The TDWG LSID Ontology is again based on earlier developments from 2007 supported in part by the Pollinators Thematic Network of the Inter-American Biodiversity Information Network (IABIN) and by the Pollination Information Management System of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO).
thesauri.title: Taxon occurrence interactions

thesauri.description: GBIF recommended terms for denoting a nomenclatural code
thesauri.title: Nomenclatural Codes

thesauri.description: Boolean values true/false
thesauri.title: Boolean Vocabulary

thesauri.description: http://spreadsheets.google.com/pub?key=tVs-UWMXnkD3slwIE8T336w&gid=3
thesauri.title: Occurrence Status GBIF Vocabulary

thesauri.description: http://www.niiss.org/cwis438/websites/GISINDirectory/tech/Concept_Info.php?ConceptID=6
thesauri.title: GISIN Species Status Trend Vocabulary

thesauri.description: http://www.niiss.org/cwis438/websites/GISINDirectory/tech/Concept_Info.php?ConceptID=4
thesauri.title: GISIN Species Status Spread Rate Vocabulary

thesauri.description: http://www.niiss.org/cwis438/websites/GISINDirectory/tech/Concept_Info.php?ConceptID=4
thesauri.title: GISIN Species Status Distribution Vocabulary

thesauri.description: http://www.niiss.org/cwis438/websites/GISINDirectory/tech/Concept_Info.php?ConceptID=5
thesauri.title: GISIN Species Status Abundance Vocabulary

thesauri.description: http://www.niiss.org/cwis438/websites/GISINDirectory/tech/Concept_Info.php?ConceptID=2
thesauri.title: GISIN Species Status Presence Vocabulary

thesauri.description: http://www.niiss.org/cwis438/websites/GISINDirectory/tech/Concept_Info.php?ConceptID=9
thesauri.title: GISIN Species Status Regulatory Vocabulary

thesauri.description: http://www.niiss.org/cwis438/websites/GISINDirectory/tech/Concept_Info.php?ConceptID=8
thesauri.title: GISIN Species Status Harmful Vocabulary

thesauri.description: http://www.niiss.org/cwis438/websites/GISINDirectory/tech/Concept_Info.php?ConceptID=3
thesauri.title: GISIN Species Status Persistence Vocabulary

thesauri.description: http://www.niiss.org/cwis438/websites/GISINDirectory/tech/Concept_Info.php?ConceptID=1
thesauri.title: GISIN Species Status Origin Vocabulary

thesauri.description: Codes for the representation of names of languages — Part 1: Alpha-2 code, is the first part of the ISO 639 series of international standards for language codes. Part 1 covers the registration of two-letter codes. There are 136 two-letter codes registered. The registered codes cover the world's major languages.
thesauri.title: ISO 639-1 Language Codes
